brief_summary.textblock:
The study is a phase 1/2 study in two parts. In part 1, the primary objective is to assess
      the pharmacokinetics of UC1010 when administered subcutaneously as a single dose to healthy
      women. The safety and tolerability of UC1010 is also evaluated in study part 1.

      In part 2, the primary objective is to assess the pharmacodynamic effect of UC1010 on
      premenstrual symptoms in women with Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD) when given during
      the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle. The pharmacodynamic effect is evaluated through the
      patients' daily ratings of premenstrual symptoms. In both study parts, two active treatment
      groups are compared to one placebo group.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I/II Study to Evaluate UC1010 Treatment in Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Part 1 -Essentially healthy

        Part 2 -Have PMDD according to DSM-IV verified in two menstrual cycles

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  steroid hormonal treatment during the previous three months

          -  treatment with psychopharmaceuticals or other treatment for PMS

          -  history of or a significant medical condition ongoing

          -  be pregnant or plan a pregnancy within the study period

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Parallel-group Study on Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of UC1010 Administered Subcutaneously, Single-dosing in Healthy Women (Part 1) and Multiple Dosing in PMDD Women (Part 2) - Phase I/II Study

primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily Record of Severity of Problems (DRSP) measured during 4-5 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
